question_text: Which statement best describes how Thunderbolt 3 achieves dual 4K monitor support over USB-C?
answer_options: It tunnels VGA over USB for legacy monitor compatibility
It uses DisplayPort over PCIe channels via USB-C’s physical interface
It converts HDMI signals to analog in the cable
It splits a DVI dual link into two parallel streams
correct_answer: It uses DisplayPort over PCIe channels via USB-C’s physical interface
explanation: Thunderbolt 3 tunnels DisplayPort signals over high-bandwidth PCIe channels using the USB-C connector, enabling dual 4K monitor support.
